column4: how do I remove blank lines in a text file with either awk or sed? I tried a few examples I found with google but none worked
hmm, my regex works with grep, not sed
sed '/^$/d' /media/disk/kiwi_words1.txt > kiwi_words2.txt doesnt generate an error but doesnt remove the spaces either
how do you point that to a file?
i am begining to wonder if there are some special charatcers on those lines because they are not getting deleted
look at the file in a hex editor
or try this:  egrep -v "^[[:space:]]*$" file1.txt > file2.txt
there is no spaces on the blank lines
then use a hex editor to see if there are nonprinting control characters on those lines
